converter (ADC) error sources and provides test methods with which to perform the required error measurements. The information in this standard is useful both to manufactures and to users of ADCs in that it provides a basis for evaluating and comparing existing devices, as well as providing a template for writing specifications for the procurement of new ones. In some applications, the information provided by the tests described in this standard can be used to correct ADC errors, e.g., correction for gain and offset errors. This standard also presents terminology and definitions to aid the user in defining and testing ADCs.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="530" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Also available via all_text_timv: IEEE standard for terminology and test methods for analog-to-digital converters / sponsor, Waveform Measurement and Analysis Technical Committee (TC-10) of the IEEE Instrumentation and Measurement Society. Standard for terminology and test methods for analog-to-digital converters IEEE Std 1241-2001 New York : Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, ©2001. v, 92 pages : illustrations ; 28 cm. text txt rdacontent unmediated n rdamedia volume nc rdacarrier IEEE standards "IEEE Std 1241-2001." "Approved 7 December 2000, IEEE-SA Standards Board." Includes bibliographical references. IEEE Std 1241-2001 identifies analog-to-digital converter (ADC) error sources and provides test methods with which to perform the required error measurements. The information in this standard is useful both to manufactures and to users of ADCs in that it provides a basis for evaluating and comparing existing devices, as well as providing a template for writing specifications for the procurement of new ones. In some applications, the information provided by the tests described in this standard can be used to correct ADC errors, e.g., correction for gain and offset errors. This standard also presents terminology and definitions to aid the user in defining and testing ADCs. Also available via the World Wide Web with additional title: IEEE Std 1241-2000. Analog-to-digital converters Standards. Analog-to-digital converters Testing Standards. Analog-to-digital converters Standards. fast (OCoLC)fst00808306 IEEE Instrumentation and Measurement Society. notes_summary_ssim: IEEE Std 1241-2001 identifies analog-to-digital converter (ADC) error sources and provides test methods with which to perform the required error measurements. The information in this standard is useful both to manufactures and to users of ADCs in that it provides a basis for evaluating and comparing existing devices, as well as providing a template for writing specifications for the procurement of new ones. In some applications, the information provided by the tests described in this standard can be used to correct ADC errors, e.g., correction for gain and offset errors. This standard also presents terminology and definitions to aid the user in defining and testing ADCs.
